text: Dionne Warwick (born December 12, 1940) is an American R&B; singer. She was born in East Orange, New Jersey. Warwick sang many songs written by Burt Bacharach and Hal David. Many of these songs were hits. In 1990, Warwick hosted and executive produced a talk show, Dionne and Friends. She was a contestant in the 2011 season of The Apprentice. Warwick's sister Dee Dee Warwick (1942-2008), their aunt Cissy Houston (born 1933) and cousin Whitney Houston (1963-2012) were singers. ==Sources== == Other websites == * Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from New Jersey Category:African-American musicians Category:American movie actors Category:American R&B; singers Category:American soul musicians Category:American television actors Category:American television presenters Category:People from East Orange, New Jersey Category:Participants in American reality television series Category:Singers from New Jersey Category:Television talk show hosts Category:Warner Bros. title: Dionne Warwick
